content:
• Wednesday, May 9, 2012
  • ENLK

    Crosstex Energy (XTEX) announces an 8.8M common unit secondary offering, along with a $250M...

    Crosstex Energy (XTEX) announces an 8.8M common unit secondary offering, along with a $250M private placement of Senior Notes due 2022. The proceeds will be used to fund its acquisition of Clearfield Energy, as well as for other general purposes. Shares -5.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 PM
  • MKTG

    More on Responsys (NASDAQ:MKTG): Q1 beats on a per share basis on a 26% Y/Y jump in total...

    More on Responsys (NASDAQ:MKTG): Q1 beats on a per share basis on a 26% Y/Y jump in total revenue. Net profit fell 1.3% however, as stock-compensation costs again masked a stronger core profit driven by higher revenue from subscriptions. The company also raises FY12 EPS guidance to between $0.21 - $0.23, and lifts its revenue forecast to around $163M - $165M. Shares +6.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:28 PM
  • RPRX

    Shares of Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) jumped +12% in the post-trade session after the...

    Shares of Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) jumped +12% in the post-trade session after the company says the FDA has ironed out trial design details and registration requirements for it's Androxal oral therapy for the treatment of secondary hypogonadism - a condition responsible for 90% of the incidence of low testostorone in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC +2.1%) finished higher on the day after filing its FQ4 10-Q. Citi (Buy)...

    Western Digital (WDC +2.1%) finished higher on the day after filing its FQ4 10-Q. Citi (Buy) points out WDC disclosed it has repurchased 7.8M shares in FQ1 as of May 8. Moreover, given the company was in a quiet period until April 26, Citi believes all of the buybacks, which cost the company $305M, occurred over the last 2 weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM
  • CJ

    C&J Energy Services (CJES): Q1 EPS of $0.92 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $239M (+88% Y/Y)...

    C&J Energy Services (CJES): Q1 EPS of $0.92 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $239M (+88% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM | 4 Comments
  • CCRN

    Cross Country Healthcare (NASDAQ:CCRN): Q1 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $122M (+4%...

    Cross Country Healthcare (NASDAQ:CCRN): Q1 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $122M (+4% Y/Y) misses by $4.5M. Shares -4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • SGI

    More on Silicon Graphics' FQ3: The company is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $177M-$197M and EPS of...

    More on Silicon Graphics' FQ3: The company is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $177M-$197M and EPS of -$0.52 to -$0.37, below a consensus of $208.9M and $0.16. SGI's reasons: a large deal slipped into FQ1, customers are delaying orders ahead of product launches due late in FQ4, and many expected deals will have low margins (a sign of price pressure?). Shares also plunged following SGI's FQ2 report (Europe was blamed). SGI -12% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • MNST

    More on Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST): Posts sharply higher-than-expected Q1 revenue growth,...

    More on Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST): Posts sharply higher-than-expected Q1 revenue growth, though the EPS beat was much more modest. Gross margin climbed to 53.1%, a full point higher, but increased operating costs more than offset that, resulting in somewhat-muted earnings growth. Shares +13.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • VRTU

    Virtusa (NASDAQ:VRTU): Q1 EPS of $0.23 in-line. Revenue of $74.2M (+27% Y/Y) beats by $2M. (PR)

    Virtusa (NASDAQ:VRTU): Q1 EPS of $0.23 in-line. Revenue of $74.2M (+27% Y/Y) beats by $2M. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • SGI

    Silicon Graphics International (NASDAQ:SGI): Q1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $199M...

    Silicon Graphics International (NASDAQ:SGI): Q1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $199M (+39% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -12% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • CSCO

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) guides on its FQ3 earnings call (webcast) for 2%-5% FQ4 revenue growth and...

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) guides on its FQ3 earnings call (webcast) for 2%-5% FQ4 revenue growth and EPS of $0.44-$0.46, below a consensus of 7.1% growth and EPS of $0.49. CSCO -8.1% AH. JNPR -2.4%. JDSU -1.9%. FFIV -1.4%. RVBD -1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • QTM-OLD

    Quantum (NYSE:QTM-OLD): Q1 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $160.3M (-2.9% Y/Y) in-line....

    Quantum (NYSE:QTM-OLD): Q1 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $160.3M (-2.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST): Q1 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $455M (+27.6% Y/Y)...

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST): Q1 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $455M (+27.6% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Shares +11% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • SVN

    7 days group Holdings (NYSE:SVN): Q1 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $545M (+30% Y/Y)...

    7 days group Holdings (NYSE:SVN): Q1 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $545M (+30% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • TSLA

    More on Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA): Q1 misses across the board, despite a 10% jump in deliveries...

    More on Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA): Q1 misses across the board, despite a 10% jump in deliveries in its European and Asian markets. The company notes initial deliveries of its Model S to customers in the United States will begin in June, one month ahead of schedule and ups FY12 guidance, now expecting to earn between $560M - $600M. Street estimates are for $561M. Shares +8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 5 Comments
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $12.6M (+31% Y/Y)...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $12.6M (+31% Y/Y) misses by $3.8M. Company blames shortfall on lack of Samsung licensing revenue, which it says will be recognized in Q2 and Q4. Maintains 2012 revenue guidance of $90M-$110M. Shares -17% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • BKNG

    More on Priceline (PCLN): Q1 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but missing slightly...

    More on Priceline (PCLN): Q1 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but missing slightly on revenue. Net profit jumped 74% Y/Y on strength in its international hotel bookings. The company also guided Q2 profit to the lower-end of estimates, now seeing an EPS of $7.20 - $7.40 with revenue growth between 18% and 23%. Street estimates were for an EPS of $7.37 on revenue growth of 26%. Shares -2.45% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • JOBS

    51job (NASDAQ:JOBS): Q1 EPS of $2.23 misses by $1.61. Revenue of $60.5M (+17% Y/Y) beats by...

    51job (NASDAQ:JOBS): Q1 EPS of $2.23 misses by $1.61. Revenue of $60.5M (+17% Y/Y) beats by $3.5M. Shares -6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • DGIT

    Digital Generation Systems (NASDAQ:DGIT): Q1 EPS of $0.05 may not be comparable to consensus of...

    Digital Generation Systems (NASDAQ:DGIT): Q1 EPS of $0.05 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.28. Revenue of $92.8M (+46% Y/Y) beats by $1.8M. Shares -2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • CHK

    Moody's lowers its outlook on Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3.6%) to negative from stable, reflecting...

    Moody's lowers its outlook on Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3.6%) to negative from stable, reflecting growing risks from CHK's massive capex plan. CHK's cash flows are vulnerable to further declines in natural gas prices, Moody's says, and it remains dependent on completing asset sales to maintain liquidity fund its transition towards higher liquids production.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • HUM

    Humana (HUM -2.5%) slips after Goldman downgraded the stock to Neutral this morning due to...

    Humana (HUM -2.5%) slips after Goldman downgraded the stock to Neutral this morning due to margin concerns and risk of lower funding levels under health reform. The firm sees better upside potential in Health Net (HNT -2.5%), Coventry (CVH -1.4%) and WellCare (WCG -1.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • ESRX

    Express Scripts (ESRX -1.8%) recent pullback presents a buying opportunity ahead of the...

    Express Scripts (ESRX -1.8%) recent pullback presents a buying opportunity ahead of the company's Q1 results on May 10, says JP Morgan. The firm attributes the pullback to concerns over guidance and potential headwinds surrounding the 2013 selling season.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +3.5%) trades up after the FDA approves its Ellipse implantable...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +3.5%) trades up after the FDA approves its Ellipse implantable cardioverter defibrillator. Designed with feedback from more than 200 physicians, the Ellipse offers physicians unique advancements, and is designed to increase patient comfort and physician ease-of-use. Separately, Morgan Stanley upgraded the shares to Overweight this morning, saying it expects the company to benefit from new cardio markets and reduced Durata concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • ORA

    Ormat Technologies (ORA +12.6%) shares jump after the provider of geothermal energy moved to a...

    Ormat Technologies (ORA +12.6%) shares jump after the provider of geothermal energy moved to a Q1 profit from a loss in the same period last year, exceeding analyst expectations. ORA raised full-year revenue guidance to $480M-$505M (product revenues $165M-$175M; reaffirmed electric revenues $315M-$330M) vs. $473M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • STEC

    While STEC (STEC -7.7%) continues to trade lower due to the poor Q2 guidance accompanying...

    While STEC (STEC -7.7%) continues to trade lower due to the poor Q2 guidance accompanying yesterday's Q1 report, rival solid-state drive (SSD) vendor OCZ Technology (OCZ +5.3%) is rallying. This suggests the Street believes the SSD qualification issues STEC blames for its guidance are opening the door for OCZ to take share. OCZ provided strong FY13 guidance last week. (Deutsche) (Needham)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • DWDP

    Dow Chemical (DOW +0.6%) hovers in the green after Morgan Stanley upgraded the shares to...

    Dow Chemical (DOW +0.6%) hovers in the green after Morgan Stanley upgraded the shares to Overweight based on expectations for lower ethane prices. The firm also raises its price target to $38 from $35.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • NBL

    Rosetta Resources (ROSE -4.8%) shares slip after Q1 earnings and revenues fell short of...

    Rosetta Resources (ROSE -4.8%) shares slip after Q1 earnings and revenues fell short of estimates. Q1 production of 33.8M boe/day was below expectations, and capital spending of $133M also fell short and contributed to the production miss. FBR Capital cuts shares to reflect its concern over the weak natural gas liquids price outlook and single asset base orientation.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • TXCCQ

    TranSwitch (TXCC -7.4%) dips after missing Q1 estimates late yesterday. Net losses widened as...

    TranSwitch (TXCC -7.4%) dips after missing Q1 estimates late yesterday. Net losses widened as revenue fell 55% Y/Y and margins weakened on higher R&D costs. Additionally, the company disclosed plans to sell up to 1.5M shares of common stock in a secondary offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • SVNTQ

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -11%) takes a hit today after its Q1 results missed estimates....

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -11%) takes a hit today after its Q1 results missed estimates. Total revenue actually jumped nearly 170% Y/Y, but bottom line margins were hit as expenses increased sharply. Much of the increase in expenses had to do with the commercialization and marketing of its new gout drug Krystexxa.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S +3%) has also caught a bid thanks to Bloomberg's report about MetroPCS/T-Mobile USA...

    Sprint (S +3%) has also caught a bid thanks to Bloomberg's report about MetroPCS/T-Mobile USA merger talks. The report notes Sprint's management discussed acquiring T-Mobile USA last year, and in February struck a deal to acquire MetroPCS (PCS +16%) before being shot down by Sprint's board.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • MED

    Weight-loss-program provider Medifast (MED -7.1%) slides after missing on its Q1 EPS result but...

    Weight-loss-program provider Medifast (MED -7.1%) slides after missing on its Q1 EPS result but beating on revenue. Net earnings fell 37% Y/Y as costs related to the company's expansion of its weight control centers have put pressure on bottom line margins. Gross margins also narrowed to 75.1% from 76.3%, primarily due to rising commodity and shipping costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS +19.7%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP +17.4%) soar on a Bloomberg report that Deutsche...

    MetroPCS (PCS +19.7%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP +17.4%) soar on a Bloomberg report that Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY) is discussing a merger between MetroPCS and T-Mobile USA. The merger would involve a stock swap, and the combined company would be publicly listed. In addition, it's claimed Deutsche is weighing an IPO or outright sale for T-Mobile USA. All three carriers have been struggling (I, II) lately, thanks to prepaid weakness and a lack of iPhone sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 4 Comments
  • LYB

    LyondellBasell (LYB +4.2%) hikes its quarterly dividend 60% to $0.40/share, signaling its...

    LyondellBasell (LYB +4.2%) hikes its quarterly dividend 60% to $0.40/share, signaling its operational strength and progress in debt restructuring. CEO Jim Gallogly says the plastics and chemical company expects to steadily increase dividends over time. Morgan Stanley raises its price target on LYB to $53 from $48, citing the likelihood of higher ethane prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • DIOD

    Analog chipmaker Diodes (DIOD -8.5%) is off sharply post-earnings. The decline comes even though...

    Analog chipmaker Diodes (DIOD -8.5%) is off sharply post-earnings. The decline comes even though Q1 EPS was in-line and the company guided for Q2 revenue of $155M-$164M, largely above a $155.5M consensus. A Q1 gross margin of 23.3% (down 150 bps Q/Q and 1220 bps Y/Y), which Diodes attributes to weak pricing, mix shifts, and inventory reductions, could be weighing on shares. Q2 gross margin is expected to be 24%-28%. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • SFLY

    Shares of Shutterfly (SFLY +5.2%) move up on heavy volume as the company continues to notify...

    Shares of Shutterfly (SFLY +5.2%) move up on heavy volume as the company continues to notify Kodak customers how to transfer photos to its platform. With a lot of potential revenue on the line, it doesn't hurt that Shutterfly ranks high on the list of online sites with the highest level of customer satisfaction.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • EXK

    Shares of Canadian miner Endeavour Silver (EXK +8.5%) shine a day after reporting Q1 adjusted...

    Shares of Canadian miner Endeavour Silver (EXK +8.5%) shine a day after reporting Q1 adjusted EPS of $0.22 vs. $0.15 analyst consensus and a 39% Y/Y rise in revenues. Silver equivalent production rose 21% to 1.39M oz., and the company sees Q2 silver production and cash costs comparable to Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • NILE

    Blue Nile (NILE +11.7%), hammered following its Q4 report, is rallying strongly after its Q1...

    Blue Nile (NILE +11.7%), hammered following its Q4 report, is rallying strongly after its Q1 report. Though EPS missed estimates, the online diamond seller's in-line sales guidance is better than many feared. Blue Nile expects Q2 revenue of $87M-$91M and EPS of $0.04-$0.10 vs. a consenus of $89.6M and $0.16, and 2012 revenue of $384M-$417M and EPS of $0.70-$0.85 vs. a consensus of $387.6M and $0.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • AVP

    Shares of Avon Products (AVP +9.1%) spike higher after a shareholder of Coty files to sell...

    Shares of Avon Products (AVP +9.1%) spike higher after a shareholder of Coty files to sell Reckitt Benckiser (OTC:RBGPY) shares - sparking speculation that a new bid for AVP could be afoot.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • WTI

    W&T Offshore (WTI -10%) shares slide after reporting Q1 earnings and revenues that trailed...

    W&T Offshore (WTI -10%) shares slide after reporting Q1 earnings and revenues that trailed analyst estimates for the first time in 10 quarters on lower natural gas prices and higher costs. WTI, one of the few mid-cap explorers focusing on the Gulf of Mexico, backed its capital budget of $425M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • MEMS

    MEMSIC (MEMS -37.8%) gets crushed after delivering its Q1 report. Though EPS of $0.05 beat by...

    MEMSIC (MEMS -37.8%) gets crushed after delivering its Q1 report. Though EPS of $0.05 beat by $0.08, the company is guiding for Q2 revenue of $14M-$16M and EPS of -$0.04 to -$0.06, below a consensus of $23.1M and $0.03. MEMSIC blames a major drop in smartphone design wins with a large customer (probably Samsung, which made up 37% of 2011 sales). Fellow MEMS chipmaker InvenSense (NYSE:INVN) cratered post-earnings last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (WPRT -6.5%) drops after its Q1 results misses estimates yesterday. Revenue...

    Westport Innovations (WPRT -6.5%) drops after its Q1 results misses estimates yesterday. Revenue soared over 132% Y/Y, but bottom line margins were still hard hit by higher expenses. The company says it expects revenue growth of about 50% this year, which would put it in a range of between $400M and $425M, in line with Street expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 4 Comments
  • TTI

    Tetra Technologies (TTI -10.4%) shares sink after the oil service provider posts...

    Tetra Technologies (TTI -10.4%) shares sink after the oil service provider posts lower-than-expected Q1 results, as unfavorable weather in the Gulf of Mexico hurt its offshore business and low natural gas prices affected demand for its U.S. onshore services. Revenues at TTI's key fluids division fell 5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • CARB

    Cloud backup/storage firm Carbonite (CARB +14.3%) rose as much as 56% over the last 20 minutes...

    Cloud backup/storage firm Carbonite (CARB +14.3%) rose as much as 56% over the last 20 minutes of trading before being halted on circuit breakers. Shares have now given up most of those gains, but remain sharply higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • SEMG

    SemGroup (SEMG +5.1%) ranks among the day's top gainers in the energy sector despite posting a...

    SemGroup (SEMG +5.1%) ranks among the day's top gainers in the energy sector despite posting a net Q1 loss of $0.03/share vs. breakeven in the year-ago period, hurt by weak performance at its storage business. Revenues fell 22% Y/Y from the loss of its SemStream unit that was sold last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • PIKE

    Pike Electric (PIKE -2.5%) slips after posting a mixed FQ3 today, beating on revenue but coming...

    Pike Electric (PIKE -2.5%) slips after posting a mixed FQ3 today, beating on revenue but coming up short on a per share basis due to higher expenses. Core service revenue totaled a record high $156M, led by double-digit gains in its distribution segment. Stifel Nicolaus reduced its price target to $11.50 based on the lower Q3 EPS, but still believes that the company's long-term trends are positive.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM -10.3%) plunges yet again in the wake of neutral coverage launches from IPO...

    Millennial Media (MM -10.3%) plunges yet again in the wake of neutral coverage launches from IPO underwriters worried about its high valuation. Shares are now down 24% from Monday's close, and 48% from a March 29 IPO-day high of $27.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • GIII

    Shares of G-III Apparel (GIII +3.0%) move higher after Standpoint Research upgrades the company...

    Shares of G-III Apparel (GIII +3.0%) move higher after Standpoint Research upgrades the company to Buy with a lofty price target of $36. Analyst Ronnie Moas sees new initiatives adding an extra $100M to the retailer's coffers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK -2.8%) shares resume losses after their big U-turn near yesterday's...

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK -2.8%) shares resume losses after their big U-turn near yesterday's close; shares had dropped nearly 14% following Q1 results but rallied on natural gas price gains. Tudor Pickering says KWK spent $137M on capital projects in Q1, above estimates; while Q1 losses of $0.09/share missed estimates, its nat gas production matched targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • KKD

    As speculated yesterday, Krispy Kreme (KKD +3.1%) stakeholder Robert Stiller dumps a large part...

    As speculated yesterday, Krispy Kreme (KKD +3.1%) stakeholder Robert Stiller dumps a large part of his holdings. A SEC filing reveals the suddenly cash-strapped GMCR exec sold 8M shares at $6.15.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD) shares well in demand and surging 17.5% after its rather positive Q1 report...

    Demand Media (DMD) shares well in demand and surging 17.5% after its rather positive Q1 report yesterday, when it increased its 2012 guidance. The results suggests Demand may have overcome, for now, Google's moves to tighten its search filters and weed out some of Demand's content, which Google 'aint so impressed with.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • TPX

    Mattress stocks Tempur-Pedic (TPX +8.7%) and Select Comfort (SCSS +4.6%) run hot off of momentum...

    Mattress stocks Tempur-Pedic (TPX +8.7%) and Select Comfort (SCSS +4.6%) run hot off of momentum trading not tied to any corporate news. Options watchers say that block trading at strategic breaking points is influencing the recent price swings in the stocks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • WYNN

    The post-mortem on Wynn Resorts' (WYNN -3.3%) double miss with its Q1 report continues with...

    The post-mortem on Wynn Resorts' (WYNN -3.3%) double miss with its Q1 report continues with analysts homing in on the decreasing margins the casino operator reported. It's also what execs didn't say on the earnings CC that still weighs heavy, as the company skips any meaningful updates on its Cotai project and leaves the impression on the Street that the high-flying resort won't be a revenue-driver until 2016.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • NLY

    Annaly (NLY +0.5%) moves higher following a dive AH yesterday on the announcement of an offering...

    Annaly (NLY +0.5%) moves higher following a dive AH yesterday on the announcement of an offering of convertible bonds and preferred stock. The yield on the convertible is just 5%, far less (unless converted) than the current dividend yield of 13.3%. "Incredible execution," tweets Dividend Master. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 5 Comments
  • TNGO

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO +17.3%) rockets to new post-IPO highs following its Q1 beat. The telecom asset...

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO +17.3%) rockets to new post-IPO highs following its Q1 beat. The telecom asset management software firm, which has made a couple of acquisitions (I, II) this year, is guiding for Q2 revenue of $35M-$35.5M and EPS of $0.09, which compares with a consensus of $34.9M and $0.09. For 2012, it expects revenue of $142.3M-$144.3M and EPS of $0.41-$0.42 vs. a consensus of $142.6M and $0.42. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two Interactive (TTWO -6.3%) sells off after announcing Bioshock Infinite won't launch...

    Take-Two Interactive (TTWO -6.3%) sells off after announcing Bioshock Infinite won't launch until Feb. 26, 2013; the company had previously promised an Oct. 16 launch. A preview of the game received a positive reception at last year's E3 conference.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • SODA

    Despite smashing earnings estimates six quarters in a row and projecting a profitable future,...

    Despite smashing earnings estimates six quarters in a row and projecting a profitable future, Sodastream (SODA +25.2%) struggles to shake off critics who tag it as the next Green Mountain Coffee Roasters. Even a potentially-blockbuster tie-up with Wal-Mart brings out the doubters, as they claim that Wal-Mart's shelves are full of stories of broken growth dreams.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 3 Comments
  • THS

    TreeHouse Foods (THS +3.9%) trades higher after catching an upgrade from Janney to Buy from...

    TreeHouse Foods (THS +3.9%) trades higher after catching an upgrade from Janney to Buy from Hold. The company increased its profit in Q1 with the help of higher prices - but warns full-year growth will fall below its original estimate of 8%-9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • XLE

    Crude oil looks headed for a sixth straight losing session, as WTI -1.3% to $95.64/bbl and...

    Crude oil looks headed for a sixth straight losing session, as WTI -1.3% to $95.64/bbl and following other commodities lower. “A further flow of negative sentiment towards Europe, and specifically Spain, is seeing general markets turning lower once again as a flight... from risk is underway,” a Summit Energy analyst writes. Energy stocks (XLE -1.8%) again take a licking.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • VRS
